pages.title: Logic Drive
pages.text: A Lua-controlled $(thing)rotation modifier$() — acts as a programmable clutch and gearbox. Enable/disable rotation pass-through, reverse direction, and multiply speed from -16x to 16x.$(br2)The $(6)orange-marked$() side is the $(thing)drive input$() — connect your power source here. The $(3)light-blue$() side is the $(thing)CC-controlled output$().$(br2)Peripheral type: $(thing)"logic_drive"$()
Place inline with a shaft. The drive modifies rotation passing through it.

pages.title: Drive Control
pages.text: $(li)$(thing)enable()$() — allow rotation through (clutch on)$(br)$(li)$(thing)disable()$() — block rotation (clutch off)$(br)$(li)$(thing)isEnabled()$() → boolean$(br)$(li)$(thing)setReversed(bool)$() — reverse output direction$(br)$(li)$(thing)isReversed()$() → boolean$(br)$(li)$(thing)setModifier(value)$() — speed multiplier (-16.0 to 16.0)$(br)$(li)$(thing)getModifier()$() → float$(br)$(li)$(thing)getInputSpeed()$() → float RPM$(br)$(li)$(thing)getOutputSpeed()$() → float RPM$(br2)$(bold)Example:$()$(br)$(#4488CC)local d = peripheral.find("logic_drive")$(br)d.setModifier(2.0)$(br)d.enable()$()

pages.title: Sequence Programming
pages.text: Build timed modifier sequences:$(br2)$(li)$(thing)clearSequence()$() — clear all steps$(br)$(li)$(thing)addRotateStep(degrees, modifier)$() — rotate by degrees at modifier (0.1-16.0)$(br)$(li)$(thing)addWaitStep(ticks)$() — pause (1-6000 ticks)$(br)$(li)$(thing)addModifierStep(modifier)$() — instant modifier change (-16.0 to 16.0)$(br)$(li)$(thing)runSequence(loop)$() — execute sequence$(br)$(li)$(thing)stopSequence()$() — halt sequence$(br)$(li)$(thing)isSequenceRunning()$() → boolean$(br)$(li)$(thing)getSequenceSize()$() → int

pages.title: Sequence Example
pages.text: $(bold)Accelerate then brake:$()$(br2)$(#4488CC)local d = peripheral.find("logic_drive")$(br)d.enable()$(br)d.clearSequence()$(br)d.addModifierStep(1.0)$(br)d.addWaitStep(40)$(br)d.addModifierStep(4.0)$(br)d.addWaitStep(40)$(br)d.addModifierStep(0.5)$(br)d.runSequence(true)$()$(br2)Use the Logic Drive as a programmable gearbox to ramp machines up and down on schedule.
